column4: When I go to resume from suspend, my screen remains black. When I move the mouse I get graphical artifacts, but if I do ctrl+alt+F1 I can get to a console (can't see it) but I can login and shutdown from there (but screen remains w/ artifacts)
sorry I've forgotten how to read that log. What do I do?
next time, login, and type sudo dmesg > ~/dmesg.log
then, after you reboot, less the file and see if anything pops out at you
dmesg is kept in ram, that's why i'm having you save it to a file before rebooting
Ok I'll try that. I'll reboot, save the log, and try again.
Do I need to log out and back in, restart gdm, or physically reboot?
whatever you need to do to be able to read the screen again
basically i want you to get the screen not readable, then save dmesg to a log, then read it...
ohhh ok. Right, hopefully I can do that, I'll just have to type carefully :)

Ok just to clarify, you want the dmesg log while I'm i the blind state, b/c if I reboot it gets lost? In that case I'll type the command in the TTY1 so (hopefully) I can just switch to that console and hit enter to save the log
yeah, then after you reboot, check it out with "tail" or "less" and see if you find anything interesting

I went through the log, didn't find anything strange, really. One thing (ata6) reported "port disabled, ignoring" and "APCI get timing mode failed". Also got one "pnp: Device 00:06 does not support activation." and "pnp: Failed to activate device 00:07...
: Everything else just said 'suspend', 'LATE suspend', 'EARLY resume' or 'resume'
